name: Walter Johnson
text: Tom is a great owner. The bread, pizza dough, and sauce are made fresh daily. I enjoyed the margarita pizza and my wife liked her ham and cheese sub. We also enjoyed a side salad.

name: Am
text: Very good place. The pizza was delicious, and the owner was very friendly. Recommended. 👍

name: Ricki Wadkins
text: I ate there when it first opened with my family and it was amazing. I got the italian spaghetti with meatballs while my dad an sister got the pizza. Like a few bites in and I was already full. Same goes with the pizza. But, it’s so good and I highly recommend. Speaking of which rn i am trying to convince my dad to take me there and get the italian spaghetti again. 🥲 btw that picture is me outside the restaurant  🤑

name: Tizzo Heavy
text:
A new Italian restaurant, located near the Lee County Flea market. Wide variety of dishes, prices are fairly reasonable. I had a late lunch here, purchased a stromboli. Restaurant was clean and quite busy. The food was very good, the mozzarella stick appetizer was well made. Stromboli was large with a good amount of cheese, meat, and veggies contained within.

*Please Note: Per the owner, everything is scratch made to order. Expect to wait a decent amount of time for your food. My order took about 30 minutes and was well worth the wait.*

Only other thing is that the parking lot is on the small side, you may have difficulty finding a space.

Overall, I enjoyed eating here. The staff was very nice and the food was excellent.

name: Famous Nate
text:
Wow a real freaking Stromboli!!! The wife and I stopped in randomly and I do believe it was the first day open. Place was super busy and there was a wait, but the food and friendly staff made up for it.

Definitely give this place a shot if you want to taste real Italian food. The menu had plenty of legit options so ill definitely be back to try more.

Thanks again

name: Jake Davis Music
text: Just ate here for the first time. Ordered to-go for my family and everything was perfect. The staff were all very busy, but still very nice and hospitable. Will definitely be returning here when I'm in this area.

name: Gymane Moody
text: Ordered over the phone and picked up our order. My daughter loves the spaghetti and pizza! She's been plowing through it since we got home. Tommie and his staff are have great customer service and make you feel welcomed.

name: Tina McCoy
text: We have tried 4 different times to get food from this place. Still haven't been served. Two times we stopped in during their business hours and they were closed. Another time I stood inside in a line, only to be told they weren't taking any more orders when I got to the counter. Evidently they had run out of food. This last time I called in an order. Was told it would be 40 minutes. We waited in the car and went in to check on the food after about 30 minutes and was told we had a few more orders ahead of us. We waited again in the car. A few minutes later  they came out and said they had no more Lasanga,  so we asked what did they have. She said if we placed another order it would be a long wait. After we had already waited over 40 minutes. No way are we going there again.

name: Nancy Wilson
text: Pizza was very good and the dessert was great also

name: Ray Wilson
text: Pizza was delicious, customer service was excellent, but the chicken wings need some work.

name: Joyce Simmons
text: Always closed or out of food

name: Marlisa Clark
text: Best Italian! Smiths Station has a gem! The garlic bread is made using fresh dough and real garlic--not garlic salt or powder. My daughter had a slice of pepperoni pizza and I had the meatball stromboli. We had zeppolis for dessert. You get large portions. I brought over half of my stromboli home

name: Reba Phillips
text: Great Quality Pizzas with Delicious Toppings. Crispy Base is my Favorite and they made that really good. Awesome staff always their to help. When i went inn This place was Rushed by People but they Served me my pizza in just 20min. Surely Visit again.

name: Coonass
text: Good pizza, bad location. I'd eat there again.

name: Jesse Dalton
text: Crust was outstanding. Toppings and cheese in good proportion. Sauce on the pizza was good. The marinara that came with the Calzone wasn't what I expected. It was like a cross between marinara and hot sauce. I'm not sure this was intended, but it gave a unique bite to it. All in all it was a pretty outstanding shop, they sell by the slice, so make a great lunch option.

name: Paula Coleman
text: "Professional Staff! Atmosphere is so inviting! Casual but very Upscale! Absolute Delicious! All the food is bursting with flavor! A must....visit there facilities for lunch, cost is very reasonable for the large portion sizes. Everything is so tasty! Love, Love Love the crab toast and the brussel sprouts!" The management staff(Nicki and Rosco) is very warm! Also, check there bar out...(great staff and fun). The drinks are the BOMB and REAL Italian wine!

name: Pete Welch
text: Great meal. Quick and attentive service. Really nice and warm feel to the decor. The oysters with granita were something unique I had not had before and would definitely have again. Buckwheat crepe with pork belly was interesting and delicious. The scallops dish was beautiful and excellent.

name: Art Hogarth
text: The staff are great and very friendly!  the food was flavorful and well presented.  i have not had a bad meal here.  Check them out and enjoy the food!

name: Steve and Deana Chapman
text: Excellent atmosphere. Casual, yet upscale. The crab toast is delicious and ample to share as a starter. The duck breast was tender and juicy. The watermelon granita with fennel cookie was the perfect ending to a great meal. Reasonably priced for exceptional food.

name: Brent Cary
text: Great menu with unique items.  I asked the server to bring me her favorite item and it was one of the best ribeye steaks I have had.  The flavors were phenomenal. Great place to eat in Birmingham.

name: Anthony Staggs
text: My wife and I came to Pizitz on a whim and... WOW, we were blown away! Fero is where it's at on every level; the atmosphere, the staff, the food and drinks were completely above what we expected. We definitely recommend to any and everyone, especially couples looking for a laid back upscale experience

name: Edward DeMellier
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We did have a couple of disappointments however. First, the oysters served with a horseradish granita was almost tasteless (they didn't charge us for the oysters after they asked how we liked them and we told the truth). After the meal was over we asked why we don't served bread, the answer was that they do if we had only asked. Otherwise our entrees were delicious and we will be back and be sure to ask for bread.

name: cam johnson
text: Ribeye was unbelievably good.  Lamb ravioli with ricotta rocked, our app was good too.  Service was good. Looking forward to returning.

name: Matthew Smith
text: Delicious... Had my birthday dinner here. Service was excellent and knowledgeable. Food was incredible (still dreaming of the Pork Osso Buco), cocktails were well done, and dessert was incredibly rich and chocolatey.

name: Ashley Teague
text: The food is outstanding and the only thing that could possibly be better than that is the incredible service. I love this place!

name: J C
text: Over salted and unimpressed.  I came in expecting something to challenge other Italian/Mediterranean restaurants in town, but came away unimpressed.  The bolognese was way over salted and nothing special, and the wine was overpriced and not unique.  I like Italian reds and the Caparzo Rosso is not unique or great.  I wanted to like this place, but I believe there are better options for similar prices.

name: Julie Sullivan
text: Stellar food in a modern setting. Pasta dishes are amazing. I loved the duck ragout and the braised lamb. My ribeye was cooked to perfection with gnocci and chantrell mushrooms. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

name: Greg Randall
text: Staff was knowledgeable & friendly, space was hip and had just the right level of noise, and the food was excellent -- well cooked/seasoned/considered.

name: Tena Diliberto
text: Delicious food and great service. We had a great meal!

name: Graham Hixon
text: Awesome adventurous Italian with fantastic staff. Never fails.

name: Todd Brownstein
text: I live in Bhm and a "foodie" friend was visiting from out of town on Sunday evening and looking for great meal to reconnect over! Unfortunately, theres a great gulf of fine dining on Sunday or Monday in the city. She was staying at the Elyton Hotel one block away (FABULOUS!) so we walked to the Patzits Food hall and THANKFULLY "Fero" keeps longer hours than the other stalls in the main hall. It was a fantastic experience from entrance to exit. The staff is welcoming and informed, and one of the owners "Charles" greeted us and watched over our two hour feast with (non-intrusive) zeal like a true restraunteur...both he and the food were delightful. The oysters with frozen granita were unexpected and divine, and her chicken with fall veggies and my scallops with an Egyptian spice sear were flawless! Even the coffee and and mascarpone beignets were exemplary. It was a grand meal in modernist restrained surroundings..exactly what we were seeking! !Bravo! "Fero" and welcome to Bhm! I'll be recommending your restaurant to everyone!

name: G. Everett Reeves
text: Amazing place with amazing food, staff, & service.

name: Timothy Gawne
text: Very good food and a nice atmosphere, but I'm not going back.  OK this seems minor, and I know that restaurants make a lot of money on wine, if I want a bargain on wine I'll go to Costco, but when you take a date to a nice restaurant, and the waitress goes over the top pushing the most expensive bottle, says only bad things about the other ones, so that if you take a more moderately priced bottle you look cheap, well, I won't say anything at the time but I won't go back.  And there was no chiller, so my very expensive Chardonnay ended up lukewarm.  And no bread.

Had the Tiramisuand it was also fabulous. Will be going again when we return for another visit to Alabama. Would recommend everyone to stop in and try!

text: Absolutely amazing!! The food is definitely authentic Italian. The mushroom ravioli is the best!!! Oh yeah, the service was wonderful!

name: *Shakin’ It Up With Shana H
text: My experience was awful. Everything we wanted to order, they did not have. I ordered steak well done and chicken Alfredo. The steak was tough and burned. The pasta was very dry and sticky. My daughter had the lasagne and some kind of bread. The bread was burned and hard. The waitress apparently was very new to the job. She was confused and kept apologizing for mishaps. But if that wasn’t enough, the chef was untidy with horrible beards. He was not familiar with cooking what so ever. And to top all that off, the chef and the manager walked out of the kitchen with a toddler in their arms. Bouncing the child around as is she was the main course. Very unsanitary, very unsafe for the child, and very unprofessional. Will not be going back. They couldn’t even get my ticket right, so I could pay and get out of there. Do better for future customers. Yuck!

name: Kent Baker
text: Worst food I've ever paid for 36 dollars for two people and we had one bit each paid and left, don't waste your time or money there

name: Rusty Shakelford
text: Yall this is some of the best home made italian food I have ever had. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. One of the owners/Chef's ( Dan ) came out to talk to us. He is a great guy. You can tell these folks love what they do and you get treated like family. If you only try one thing. Get the Brewton Standard pasta.

name: Allen Sparks
text: Great food, Great Staff, Great Chefs, and the tiramisu?!? Just make sure to save me a piece to go!!! 👍

name: Trent Bell
text: Delicious food, good service, our new favorite place to eat in brewton!

name: Debra Bell
text: Wonderful food in a great atmosphere with terrific service!!

name: Tonna Saunders
text: Great little Italian place. The stromboli is amazing, and my friend is addicted to their brushetta. Pizza fries, come on, you cant hate pizza toppings on waffle fries. They have pasta, sandwiches, they even have wings! Great place and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Stacey Suttles
text: My kids and I loved it! Pizza was so delicious and the Wings (Italian) were awesome. We'll definitely come back again and again!!!

resp.text: Thank you Stacey!

name: Thomas B
text: Ordered the Spinach and Feta Cheese Bread for an appetizer, along with the Eggplant Parm and the white lasagna florentine with chicken. Everything was very fresh and extremely tasty. The sauces were bright and full of flavor, and each item was clearly cooked right when we ordered it. Pizza dough was crazy good, maybe best in Tuscaloosa. Will be coming back.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure serving you today.

name: Traci Watkins
text: A friend and I had lunch here today for the first time.  It was delish!!  The portions were super large, the Greek salad dressing was really good and the salad was so fresh.  The chicken parmesan was delish as well.  Waiter was super friendly!  We will definitely be going back soon!

name: Narkeita Robert
text: This was my first time at Anthony's 10/24/15 and  I gave it three stars based on the food alone. The food was very good. However, that's where it stops.  The service was bad and the bathroom was nasty. Anthony's would be good for take out no more dining in.

name: Christopher Snell
text: Good food, friendly staff and timely service.

name: Akins Josh
text:
Went for lunch 9/9/15 approximately 1150.  It is a seat yourself place. That has its ups and downs.  Ups sit where you like, not where you are lead.  Down:  The server for that section may not know you are there.  After looking over the menu twice and discussing the options provided, roughly 10 mins; we got approached by the waitstaff for drinks.  The place was not very busy, but there were other folks there.  Got our order in. Eggplant Parm, the Italian, and order of cheese breadsticks.  It took a while for the chow to hit the table.  The Eggplant Parm was a big portion  looked really tasty.  The Italian  was wee for a 8-9 dollar sandwich, i would say less than 6 inches of it total.  The meat cuts were great though.  Cheese bread.... can't tell you just yet, as it has not arrived.  My side salad was fair.  The Greek dressing was really good.  However the onions were old as they had become translucent and the red had seeped into the meat of the veggie. My friend had to get up to get his tea refilled.  The waitress did not even acknowledge that she had not returned with his drink.  I scarfed up my sandwich after removing the onions.  Good, but not valued correctly in my opinion at the cost point.  When i had cleaned up my area, just a thing i do having been a server, my cheese breads arrived.  They came with an apology about a mix up in the kitchen. Things happen.  They were the best thing out of all that was ordered.

What this place needs to do to stay alive in a market flooded with food options :
*know that this place is new and are working on finding their rhythm

1.  Bring on better wait staff, and add another the floor
2.  Re-evaluate their price points on certain items.  There Special was a great deal!
3.  Polish the time from order to table.

I will be going back in a month or two to see how things have changed.  It has some great things going for it.  I fear that the simple things against it could keep first timers from coming back.

resp.text:
Hi Josh, thank you for your feedback. We have made some changes to our staff and changed the bread for the sandwich. It is a much better portion now. I hope you will try us again. As a new restaurant, we did have a few challenges but I feel confident that we are better now. If you have any questions or concerns, please call me at 523-7548.
Thank you again,
Tina

text: Good food for the price. I went for lunch and it was pretty empty for a Saturday afternoon. Food came out in a timely fashion, and was hot and ready for consumption. There needs to be a better selection of seafood, as I found it to be a little lacking. The staff was friendly and willing to help me decide on what I should try. Tables and silverware were clean, and the food area seemed to be set up in a thought out way.

name: Willie Veasey
text: Carrabba's is always good.  However, I didn't eat there this time (though i have before).  My guest and I decided we wanted some place with more vegetables, so we went to another restaurant.  The food at this Carrabba's is very good and they give you enough food to take some home for dinner.  Price is a little pricey, with the average meal being about $15, but like I said, you get enough for dinner.

name: Eric Lewis
text: Its a chain, but they do a good job with generic Italian. Fair wine selection, not extensive, but you can ask the servers if they have anything not on the list. Sit at the pasta bar for  great cooking show during dinner, and some free samples! Employees and servers usually have a great attitude!

name: William Finney Jr
text: Always a great experience, and great food! I ended up going a couple of days before it was shut down. Glad I got to enjoy it one last time.

name: Mike Poe
text: The service started out prompt and the food was great. We then ordered dessert and a glass of Remy Martin 1738. The waitress return with the dessert and check but no drink and left. After asking about the drink she said they didn't have it so I ask for Grand Mariner. 6 minutes later she said it would be just a minute. Then 5 minutes later another waiter ask if everything was ok and then offered to get the drink. A few minutes later he returned with the drink but it had something floating in it so I returned it. By the time the drink was delivered the dessert was long gone which made the drink somewhat pointless.

name: Ivy Harris
text: This place is so great!!! Nice place to go for a first date, outing with friends or family, and even a business luncheon. The staff is friendly, organized, and knowledgeable of the menu. The food is great...it's fresh and prepared as ordered. My fiancé and I go every once in a while and we have never had any complaints. We will continue to visit. I must mention that this place puts Olive Garden to shame and it's so worth the money.

name: Lisa Avalos
text: I  hate seeing bad reviews about my favorite restaurant. I've been there so many times and I've never had a problem. Service is always great and the food is always hot and delicious. The deserts are so good. I'm always picky about deserts. I've tired all the deserts at Carrabba's and I give them all a thumbs up!

name: Dave Holmes
text: The employees we interacted with were awesome Corbin, and Roy were very friendly and helpful. The food was cooked to spec. Definitely worth the money. And on a sunday too.

text: I read the reviews and was like no let's try something else but I read a comment about experiencing it yourself and I am happy to that I did. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!

text: Amazing food. Amazing service.  Never been disappointed here.

name: mlybgabies
text: I've tried to place an order over the phone tonight 4 times and have been placed on hold for more than 15 minutes each.  Held on the line just to see how long it would take for them to come back to the phone and nothing.  Called again only to be told could you hold for a moment please--another 15 minute wait. If this is customer service; then I'd hate to see how long it would take to get my food.  I tried online before, only to get there and my order could not be located.  This is the last straw!  Will find another Italian restaurant.

name: Crystal Wickersham
text: I've been going to this carrabbas for at least the last 4 yrs to celebrate my birthday but this year was absolutely the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant of this scale and price. Service was horrible, took forever to get our drinks once seated after an hour wait, my first glass of wine had lipstick on rim of glass that wasn't mine, appetizers were brought out right before our main dish with salads and bread, steaks prepared wrong, mashed potatoes weren't completely done, no angel hair pasta (my absolute favorite item), and some items were never delivered... And it was not very busy by this time. Seemingly lazy, incompetent and unconcerned staff in regards to customer service and customer satisfaction. Manager was nice enough but somewhat nonchalant about the situation and I'm pretty sure I was not the first to discuss these issues with him last night and I think most of his staff should be dismissed and replaced with people who actually provide the type customer service expected when spending the amount of money we spend here every year. I was embarrassed by the end of the night to have brought my friends and family to this location and have no intentions of returning.

name: Amelia Blackwood
text: Total outrage this place closed, and with no real reason or explanation!  The closest Italian competition (by proximity, mean) was down the street - old & worn, the O.G. (Olive Garden- obviously).  This place paled in comparison to the menu at Carrabba's - free salad & breadsticks be damned...I'm willing to pay more for better quality food & service any day.

name: Juanita Washington
text: After reading the other reviews I had to correct them by saying pleases don't read come and experience this lovely restaurant for yourself. My wait time was short food came out hot waitress was very professional I can't with all of the post I read . If you are reading this judge not unless you walk in there shoes

name: Curt Brewer
text: The Creamy Parmesan dressing is EXCELLENT to dip your bread into. That is a meal in itself.

name: Hamp Dallas
text: Great!!!

name: Antron
text:
After Young Barn Oysters and Pub failed me miserably in the food department and since I was still very much starved, I ventured over to Carrabba's. Surely an Italian restaurant can't mess up Italian dishes. Hence my sarcasm.

I wanted something quick, to-go. The venue was quite busy so I knew it'd be a little while before my order was ready. No problem. But after about 40 minutes I started getting a little antsy. I walked over to the VERY friendly young woman whom I had placed my order with. She advised it'd just be a few more minutes.

She was right, my food (I ordered the Pasta Linguine w/shrimp and scallops, and a Chicken Ceaser salad), was ready in those few minutes she mentioned. My order was totally screwed--the blame could be placed on me for not checking my food before I left, but that's not my job to know their job.

My chicken Ceaser salad didn't have any chicken. They had placed the chicken that was supposed to be on the salad on the linguine. And they also placed some vegetable soup with my order. I don't even like vegetable soup. The pasta was totally dry as well, it was supposed to have a tomato, creamy sauce but maybe mine disappeared, because it certainly wasn't anywhere to be found.

I ended up at least trying to eat some of the pasta but it prematurely & intentionally went into the trash. The salad was fresh though.

With so many restaurant offerings it often hard to give a spot another shot, nothing different in this case.

name: William Streetman
text: So it takes a lot for me to get mad enough to leave a review on a restraunt. But as someone that eats out a lot, my experience earlier tonight was terrible. Our waiter forgot our drink orders, mixed up the sides, and the person that brought our food out Didn't even ask us if we wanted shredded cheese like yall ask every time. Now when I got my food it was overcooked. I'm not sure who the chef is, but please ask them to cook the Chicken Marsala for less time please. Lastly the sweet tea, it tasted like watered down leaves. Please make actual tea. I will be looking back at this review and I'll come back if all of this is fixed.

resp.text: Hello Mike! We had a conversation and I understood you correctly. I recall your question and replying “yes, we cut them this time to make them easier to eat (per customer suggestion). They used to be 3 large meatballs and now there are 6 halves-same amount”. We have an accent but we have been understanding and serving customers with respect, and great Italian food for over 27 years. We hope you to see you back!

text: Microwaved my pizza...

name: Carlie Hertel
text: Had a great dinner experience here. Everything from appetizers to the entrees to the desserts were divine. I highly recommend the Cheese Ravioli. If it would have been acceptable, I would've gotten three or four orders of it just for me! Our waitress was Crystal and she made sure that would were fully taken care of! I strongly recommend that you make this one of your stops on your vacation to Orange Beach!!

name: Lonnie Craft
text: My wife and I went to Benedetto's to eat as we are always looking for different places to dine out on the beach. We were greeted by the owner and seated quickly. She told us our waiter would be right with us. The restaurant was nicely appointed with 7 other tables of customers, all small parties. Approximately 15 to 20 minutes later, our waitress finally came and took our drink order. Drinks were served and we waited quite a while for her to come back and take our orders. When she finally came to take our orders, my wife ordered their version of Shrimp and Grits and I ordered Chicken Marsala.  Our food was served after a 30 minute wait and looked fairly good. The Benedetto's Italian version on shrimp and grits was shrimp and polenta and looked fairly good. My Chicken Marsala had 4 tiny strips of chicken breast in it, the "shrimp and grits" was cold. My wife asked for it to be heated or a hot plate made. 40 minutes later I had finished my bland meal, my wife had still yet to receive and food. They then had the unbelievable gall to charge us for her food too.

name: Jim Wilson
text: Great experience! The service was attentive and professional. The view of the marina was relaxing and the food, prepared from scratch (including the pasta) was exceptional. I had the chicken Marsala and my wife said her spaghetti and meatballs was the best she ever had.

name: Joelle Jordan
text:
Worst restaurant experience I have ever had. Not one thing was good about this place.
I had plastic in my salad. They forgot my drink. My pasta was dry. My desert was just a soupy mess instead of a cake. And to top it all we had to wait 45 min to an hour for our food.
Hopefully once they've been opened awhile they'll get better. But the way it was going they wont last long.

Even the table next to us had a lot of problems. They returned their food.

name: Mary Scholz
text: Had an awesome lunch at Benedetto's.  Started with a salad with all kinds of greens dressed with a champagne vinegrette that had just enough sweet to offset the tart.  Fettuccine Alfredo featured pasta that had to have been made that morning.  Portion was enough to take some home for dinner.  Our small fry diner had a flat bread pizza that was very yummy and was accompanied by a choice of fries or fruit.  She was helped into choosing fruit and then had to fight us off from stealing some of her apples, strawberries, pineapple, blueberries AND blackberries.  The restaurant decor is upbeat modern, tall tables and great views of the dock activity.  Lovely place to relax and enjoy summer.

name: GW Weathers
text: If Imcould give this place a -1 I would.  We arrived at 6:15 p.m., were seated and ordered soon thereafter.  At 7:45, no food.  We asked that it be served in to go boxes because of time constraints.  When we finally got to our food, the pasta was sticky, and terrible.  Save your money and try to find a nice place to eat.

name: Mark Cecil
text: We had an excellent experience at Benedetto's. The food was very good, the service was excellent, the ambiance is nice, and the view is beyond compare. Highly recommend them!

name: Pam Iorio
text: The entire family loved their meal. Views are incredible. Pasta all homemade. So delicious!

name: Ez Pyro
text: Great food, handmade noodles, house made sauces, great view of the bay,  oh and the best part our server Chrystal ask for her she was one of the best severs I have had in a very long time.

name: David Davis
text: FORT MORGAN SUPPER CLUB met at Benedettos Italian Restaurant on May 23, 2016. They just opened for business 10 days ago, and are located in Orange Beach above Wolf Bay Lodge Restaurant directly on the water at Zekes Landing. There is an elevator to assist those with difficulty climbing. The decor was appropriately Italian, with lots of charm. The menu was pricey and surprisingly had no veal or eggplant parmagini, nor lasagna. Our waiter, TJ, was pleasant and trying to make the best of a bad situation.  The bread was a sliced Italian loaf, but it was not warm, and they had run out of garlic butter. They did not offer olive oil and pesto as most Italian restaurants do, but TJ did his best by creating an olive oil and fresh ground pepper plate for the bread. Meals were alacarte, and did not include a salad. Nor could you add a side salad for a nominal extra charge. You could buy a tossed salad large enough to share for $12. The appetizers were about $12 each and none were ordered. Each of the eight of us ordered something different for maximum sampling of the food. The tuna special at $26 was overcooked and not fresh. It was sent back. The chicken marsala was overcooked and dry. The pasta did not taste fresh.There was not one of the eight dishes judged outstanding. Prices varied from various flatbread items at $12 to an 8 ounce filet for $32. Each item is pictured in the Facebook FORT MORGAN SUPPER CLUB page with comments from those attending. The desserts averaged $8 and none were ordered. In summary Benedettos has birth pains and was disappointing to all. Service was slow on an almost dead night with only 3 tables of customers in the house. I can only imagine the chaos this weekend when the 100 days of Summer kicks off with huge hungry crowds EVERYWHERE.

name: Gary Neat
text: Good food and view,  but menu had few choices. Otherwise a 5

text: Great

name: J4s Momma
text: Very disappointed. Bartender was playing poker on his phone  the entire time.  We had to remind him to even get our drinks . Very slow service. Drinks were very overpriced. Happy hour was supposed to be from 5 to 9.. got there at 7:30 and paid $7 per drink and the website said $2. Asked for bread 3 times finally got some roles with cold marinara sauce. Asked for water twice because the bartender was so caught up in a poker game he forgot to get the water :30 minutes before the restaurant was closing was asked if we could shoot pool and he told us that the restaurant is close. Overall experience was very disappointing.

text: Me & my son came to town today for the Import Alliance & was searching for a good Restaurant. My son tried the party melt & I got the Turf & Surf, which is a Ribeye steak & Shrimp, mine was fried shrimp. I must say it was totally delicious! The steak was cooked to perfection, the Shrimp were battered & cooked to perfection. I ordered onion rings with the steak & they brought me a baked potatoes only bad thing I can say about the whole experience but they brought the onion rings & they were delicious. If your visiting Talladega I strongly recommend this Restaurant! Worth the money for sure!

text: I Was in Lincoln for work. I was there for only a couple of nights. I had never been there before so I googled restaurants near me. Myself and my significant other decided to try the Magnolia restaurant. I chose the shrimp scampi from quite an extensive menu. She decided on chicken Parmesan. We absolutely loved it. The prices were moderate but the quantity and quality of the food was outstanding. I felt a little guilty for eating 5-star food for a 3-star price. We made sure to return the next night. We ate early on Monday evening and Tuesday evening about 5:00 pm each evening. Both nights I was somewhat shocked at the sparcity of the restaurant attendance. I know very little about the area and I know it was late January, but come on Lincoln, Talledega, Oxford, Sylacauga and yes even Birmingham, don’t deny yourselves a wonderful culinary experience.

text: I'll keep it short and sweet: Really solid food, great bread served before the meal, decent beer selection. Nice place with a big patio, nice and clean spot. Overall very solid experience, didn't change my life but I would definitely eat here again. The Papa's Italian Grinder was 👉 👍 👍

name: Chad Scroggins
text:
Very nice space to eat inside and out. But as previous reviewers have said my party was only ones to start and 2 other parties came in during lunch. Only 1 server in place and 1 cook. Food was good but cheese bread even having great taste crust on bottom not brown still taste little raw. Then pizza came out and looked beautiful edges kinda blackened as most pizza ovens do with new rage of oven fired!! But seems to be cooked with outside and bottom middle layer with meat cheese then sauced on top afterwards with grated cheese. So inside is barely warm top sauce not warm at all and crust cooked well done. Again the taste is great very fresh ingredients just not piping hot as you would expect directly out of oven!

Lunch was no crowd but had to ask for refills and flag down only server in the place as she waited on just us and before leaving 2 other tables while trying to sit and do something on her laptop the entire visit. Not very attentive to say the least.

So in review great space to eat, great tasting food just needs to be warmer temperature wise and staff needs to be increased or have more attentive. Would try here again but this place needs a little work to perfect it. So disappointed over all but not to the point to not try again!

Really want to like this place but for now needs so improvements!!

text: They spent a lot on the remodel and it looks great. Ordered pizza that looked good and was extremely disappointed (threw it away bad). Crust OK, toppings plentiful, hardly any cheese and the sauce was bad, real bad. Canned, sweet, and over powered the whole pizza. Good luck if you try it.

There were a few hiccups (understandable for 1st day of business); however, the staff definitely did everything in their power to make up for it. If you want fantastic service & true Italian style pizza, this is the place to go. We'll definitely be back!

name: Tim Suggs
text:
My wife and I decided to try this fairly new to Mountain Brook "Italian Kitchen". We were seated at a super small table and we ordered bruschetta as an appetizer, my wife ordered the house meatballs, and I ordered their chicken alfredo spaghetti. When the "Bruschetta" arrived, our table was now "full" with the plate containing the "toast" with tomatoes masquerading as"bruschetta", and our two dining plates.  Normally, bruschetta is served on some type of grilled French, or "specialty" bread. Nope, ours was served on 3 pieces of "toast", cut diagonally, and fresh out of the bread wrapper.  Only the first piece was edible because the reason you don't use fresh bread is because it becomes soggy very quickly which is exactly what happened with the following 5 pieces of "toast". Oh, they tried to help it out by charing the bread pretty good, but it didn't keep the center of each slice from literally folding over and dumping the bruschetta all over the plate, table AND my clothes as I tried to eat it. The overly toasted crusts were best used to dip my wife's meatball sauce while she wasn't looking.

Soon, my chicken alfredo spaghetti arrived, and it looked nice, creamy, no place to put it however on our uselessly small table so I had to give up my dining plate and just eat my remaining bruschetta straight off of the serving platter...  AND...  WAIT A MINUTE... that's not spaghetti, it's penne pasta. We summoned our waiter, and he apologized but said that he was pretty sure that the chicken alfredo was always served over penne pasta. After requesting the menu again, I pointed out the word "spaghetti" in the description of their "Chicken Alfredo Spaghetti" and he quickly disappeared. Soon, a woman, whom did not introduce herself, appears at our table and says "So, you're not a penne kind of guy huh?". I replied, "No, I'm not."  She then tells me that they are "out of spaghetti" and that she'll "get them to make me anything else on the menu". What she's really telling me is WoW, you do know the difference between spaghetti and penne pasta, AND noticed that we just substituted what you ordered with whatever we had...

My wife was about half through with her house meatballs by this time so I told that I was fine and didn't wish to order anything else. And she hopped right up and disappeared as quickly as my appetite had, never to be seen again.  I left slightly ahead of my wife and when our server told me "Hope to see you again soon...", I just replied, "You won't" as I made my way to the street.

I really don't understand how anyone can find this sort of treatment "acceptable". I don't, and they've lost me, my recommendation to my friends and family, coworkers, business customers and clients as a place to get a good meal and have a nice time.

name: Matthew Miller
text:
Out of a possible 5 stars I give this place a 2 star rating.  They get 1 star for the location and hours (they are open late) and 1 star for food quality (the food is pretty tasty).

Where Uncle Maddio's is missing out on a couple of stars from my review, is the ease and speed of ordering, cleanliness of the restaurant, and the overall customer experience.  Let me state for the record, the pizza, salads and cookies at this place are pretty delicious, and I do enjoy the food.  However, the path to get this tasty food isn’t always easy or pleasant and could use some improvement.

I have been to this location of Uncle Maddio's at least 5 or 6 times since they opened almost a year ago.  I have ordered in person at the restaurant (this takes forever), online (they lost my order somehow and when I got the restaurant they had to figure out what I had ordered and re-make it) and then one time I attempted to place an order over the phone (but they didn't answer the call).

Tonight I arrived at Uncle Maddio's at 8:00 pm to pick up some food on my way home from work.   There was one person in front of me in line ordering a pizza.  She was attempting to order a wheat crust medium pizza with a pesto base, chicken, pineapple, spinach, and peppers.   The lady behind the counter seemed to be struggling the entire time.

First she was having trouble with the wheat dough and asked a manager to come help with the dough.  The manager helped with the wheat dough but then left and went back to sanding behind the counter with his clipboard just looking around.

At this point there are now about 5 or 6 people in line behind me.    The girl behind the counter then the advised the first customer that they didn’t have the pineapples.  After yelling at someone to get more pineapples, the girl behind the counter left and went down to the walk-in cooler to fetch the pineapples.

After waiting about 10 or 12 minutes, it was finally my turn to order.  I ordered a “create your own” small (the $7.99 variety).  This created another problem because they didn’t have the traditional dough for this and yet again the girl behind the counter had to make a tip to the walk in cooler.  At this point the girl behind the counter seem to be really flustered, but this always seems to be the choke point at this restaurant.

You would think that as a restaurant you would want to make the first interaction with your customers as easy, fast and pleasant as possible.  This does not seem to be the case at Uncle Maddio’s – the ordering line is always the very disorganized and slow and usually results in me being VERY frustrated by the delay.  Next I go down to the cashier, who asks me to repeat my order.  This is usually pretty easy for me since I only order a single pizza with three toppings.  However, if you ordered several items or a couple pizzas you might want to bring a notepad and pencil with you when ordering.  I have never quite understood why the people at Uncle Maddio’s can’t write down what you order and just pass that info down to the cashier?  That seems reasonable right?

So tonight after paying, I go to sit a table while I wait on my pizza to bake in the oven.  This place is dirty.  The tables haven’t been cleaned, trash is overflowing and I just had that grimy nasty feeling like this place is not kept clean.  Again this is not my first time at this location and this level of cleanliness, or lack there of, seems to the norm.

This place certainly can improve the ordering process, cleanliness, and overall customer experience but that just doesn’t seem to be a big concern for the management team that runs this place.

text: Best food on the strip

name: James Patillo
text: The food isn't what it used to be, but it is still good.

resp.text: Hi James, I'm Ash, the owner of Tut's. Thank you for leaving a review, whenever it's convinent for you, can you let me know what was different about the food?

name: Caroline Odom
text: Already a staple of my time in Tuscaloosa. I can't imagine a better pizza.

resp.text:
Thank you for visiting us, please come back and get free fries and drink with purchase of any sandwich,
Ash

name: Matt Alharbi
text: Beautiful restaurant.

name: Allen (Buzz_Kill)
text: Pictures on here are very misleading. I went here expecting awesome Gyros, but didn't get them. What I got didn't have red onions, or tomatoes, and only 2 tiny slices of lamb. It had a ton of sauce, way more sauce than meat, and no feta cheese.  Why have things on the menu if you are not going to make it right?

name: Joe F. Watson
text: This is a great place to gas up, get a quick, hot meal or stock up on your way to the beach.

name: Bill Utfi
text: Very clean .Excellent Costumer Service

name: marcos cuevas
text: Best food ever!!!

name: Rami Sedda
text: Delicious food

name: Edward Jones
text: Pretty good flavor and right amount of dough. I'm not a super thin crust type of person but neither am I a deep dish lover either. Their buffalo wings were tasty. Celery was crunchy. I mention this because there's not much worse than wilted, soggy, soft old celery.

name: Ruth Santa Cruz
text: Nice and clean and organized great management

name: Joshua Jones
text: Good

name: Katrina Bonds
text: My husband recommended dining here and it was walking distance from the Battle House Hotel where we stayed. The place is small but they offer some tables outdoors for dining. We opted to dine inside. Since it was a bit busy, there were a few tables needing to be bused. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. We order the Le Cadillac pizza, beer and Caesar salad. The food was very good! The playlist was 80’s music which we enjoyed.

name: Shalayna Goza
text: Pizza was great, they let us tweak a speciality pizza they had, server was friendly, we recommend the one called Le Cadillac.

name: Chris Wilson
text: Pizza and pasta dishes are great.  Nice to enjoy dinner out on the sidewalk

name: Jennifer Conroy
text: Got there the place look like it had been shut down for at least a couple of months. Don't know what's going on maybe it's due to the 19 but be aware call before you go

name: Joseph R. Elder
text: The pizza was wonderful and the Chianti was good. Our server was extremely competent and at the same time delightfully entertaining!

name: Katie Corley
text: We went around 7pm on a Saturday night. It was pretty busy but they were able to serve us quite quickly. We thoroughly enjoyed the fresh pizza and the calzone! The fresh mozzarella cheese made the calzone perfect. Highly recommend it.

name: Priscilla McCants
text: My husband took me here for a date and we both left disappointed and underwhelmed. The place is small but I was actually excited about that because I thought the food would be authentic and tasty. I ordered a calzone. Husband ordered spaghetti and meatballs. I cut into my calzone and noticed that the dough on the inside was raw and undercooked. It was so undercooked in the center that the cheese crumbles inside hadn't melted. The servers were nice but after waiting 10-15 minutes for them to replace my calzone for spaghetti and meatballs, I told my husband to get the check so we could go. I left hungry. My husband said the spaghetti and meatballs weren't that good either.

name: Jenny Mclester
text: My best friend has been talking constantly about this place so she finally took me to try it.  It did not disappoint.   We went on Thursday afternoon.   We ordered a couple of glasses of wine.  We started with the small Greek salad and the bruschetta. I can’t describe how good those 2 items were.  For our entree,   I had the Clam Sauce and linguine and she got the Shrimp Alfredo.    I can’t wait to bring my family back to try it.  This was amazing. The prices were very reasonable also!

name: Stephanie Creel
text: So so good! I highly recommend Le Cadillac!

name: Alec Bauman
text: A very nice and quaint little place. Great food and a good menu full of easy italian!

name: Ophelie Desmet
text: The pizza was fine, not bad and not great. The price was really cheap so I guess you get what you pay for and for the price I cannot complain. The service was lacking. They made several mistakes (wrong order, no cutlery) but that could be because the person was new. The place was cash only and charges for paying with card, however no one said anything until we noticed this charge on our bill.

name: Barbara Lambert
text: Best Calzone we've had. Nice, light crust easy to cut.  Very bug we could have shared one.  I got sausage and ham, hemusbamd got meatball. Buth scrumptious. Next time we're in Mibile, AL we will go back. Highly recommend

name: Isabelle Moseley
text: After coming here for the first time a couple of weeks ago we came back because everything had been so fantastic!! This round was pretty disappointing. About ten minutes after ordering the chicken Florentine pizza our server came back to tell us they had run out of spinach. Not a huge deal, but a little frustrating. I ordered an extra side of sauce with my pizza and was brought a bowl of sauce and charged $4. Not a bad price for a bowl of alfredo sauce, but not what I was expecting when asking for a side of sauce. Maybe a 2 ounce ramekin for $1-2, or even just a warning that it would be a larger portion for $4. Whatever, still not a huge deal. Service was slow and by the time we ordered dessert(about 20 minutes til close) they had run out of sweet tea. The cherry on top was tiramisu that was frozen completely solid. I will definitely be back to give this place another chance because the pizza is so so good. This trip was just not good.

name: Kristin Byrd
text: The food here was so delicious!!! I’ve been thinking about the pasta primavera since I left. I don’t know how the garlic sauce is cooked but heaven is in it. I had the meatball as an appetizer- delicious. Pizza- delicious. Absolutely NO complaints, at all. If you visit here, you will not be disappointed.

name: Christina McDaniel
text: Amazing little Italian restaurant in the heart of downtown Mobile. Amazing service and more amazing food!!

name: Nikki Gruner
text: This is a cute little Italian place with pizza and pasta. We had the gardenia pizza and it was fantastic! The service was very good and the food was inexpensive.

name: Meli Harrison
text: Very good service and the food was great and price was very reasonable also. Huge bowl of soup was $4. That plus a calzone was more than I could. Definitely recommend.

name: Baron Degenhardt
text: Had their Chicken Alfredo to go. Delicious! I would highly recommend.

name: Barbara Lambert
text: Best Calzone we've had. Nice, light crust easy to cut.  Very bug we could have shared one.  I got sausage and ham, hemusbamd got meatball. Buth scrumptious. Next time we're in Mibile, AL we will go back. Highly recommend

name: Isabelle Moseley
text: After coming here for the first time a couple of weeks ago we came back because everything had been so fantastic!! This round was pretty disappointing. About ten minutes after ordering the chicken Florentine pizza our server came back to tell us they had run out of spinach. Not a huge deal, but a little frustrating. I ordered an extra side of sauce with my pizza and was brought a bowl of sauce and charged $4. Not a bad price for a bowl of alfredo sauce, but not what I was expecting when asking for a side of sauce. Maybe a 2 ounce ramekin for $1-2, or even just a warning that it would be a larger portion for $4. Whatever, still not a huge deal. Service was slow and by the time we ordered dessert(about 20 minutes til close) they had run out of sweet tea. The cherry on top was tiramisu that was frozen completely solid. I will definitely be back to give this place another chance because the pizza is so so good. This trip was just not good.

name: Scott Edwards
text: Great spot for pizza and pasta in downtown Mobile   fresh mozzarella tomato and basil antipasto and 2 types of pizza.  Small spot where you seat yourself.   No frills but the food is solid

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: You have to stop by when you are in the area. The pizza and pasta was delicious! The service was top notch. Also, the portion sizes were incredibly generous. The place has a homey feel and is simply decorated with pieces from local artists. I'll be back! #favorite #letsguide #mytopten

name: Sandrina Vaughn
text: The pasta was so yummy, and more now.

name: Baron Degenhardt
text: Had their Chicken Alfredo to go. Delicious! I would highly recommend.

name: Vijay Alagarraj
text:
Service was good but food was not: Cesar salad didn’t have enough dressing or croutons.
We got Gardenia pizza: it was soggy (May be from too much toppings?).

name: Ovad A Metab
text: Amazing pizza 🍕

name: Clay Lambert
text: This place was just a short walk from the Hampton Inn and had good reviews.  My wife had a sausage and ham Calzone and I had a meatball Calzone.  They were both delicious.  If you are in the area you should definitely eat here.

name: Pennie Ferrazzano
text: Excellent food and great service! Oh so yummy! The pasta Bolognese and Alfredo pasta were soooo good!

name: Soul Seasoned
text: Tiny pizzeria with authentic artisan pizza crust, nestled in a beautiful location with plenty of treelined, southern scenes. We got mushroom, onion and green olive on ours.  It came loaded with cheese.  Service was succinct but adequate.

name: Garrett Munguia
text: Pizzas were delicious. But they didn't have bottled water! I was only left with the option of coca cola products or alcoholic beverages. Very tasty!

name: Scott S
text: Wow... most excellent food! Home made! Large portions and a great staff!

name: Pennie Ferrazzano
text: Excellent food and great service! Oh so yummy! The pasta Bolognese and Alfredo pasta were soooo good!

name: Tarun Mutukuri
text: Good food for the prices they offer it at. Didn't know that the place was a cash only place and was charged a little surcharge when we paid with a card and we weren't informed of it before they charged the surcharge.

name: Jennifer Carter
text: Even though I just had a salad it was still good. Others had a meatball calzone that I tried and it was beyond good. Definitely worth another visit.

name: Kristen Cheek
text: Awesome food,  awesome service.  Definitely recommend! Can't wait too come back and visit. Best chicken salad sandwich ever.

name: Ashley Johnson
text: The single pizza slices were excellent 👌 but the inside of the establishment had flies disturbing us the entire meal. For 60 we expected to at least be served on regular plates and glasses not plastic. Lastly our pasta was completely disgusting and noodles we're over cooked. Not one person  finished their food. We definitely will not be returning here

name: D Workman
text: The Greek salad was amazing!

name: TheChowington
text:
I had one bad experience with this restaurant- I contacted the owner and he immediately went out of his way to make it right.
I waited a few months before I took him up on his offer of replacing my meal. I picked up my replacement meal today and it was spot on. I am glad they have a good owner who truly values his customers.

name: Shane Singleton Sr.
text: I work there we have good pizza and pasta any kind of pasta you want come on by and check it out

name: Talitha Wilson
text: I went with my family while they were visiting Mobile before heading out on a cruise. So we simply walked in off the street and received great customer service, the chicken Alfredo was the best I had ever tasted. And every dish that my family had eaten that evening was thoroughly enjoyed. I will be going back for sure. Please try this Italian pizzeria out if ever on Dauphin Street or in the area.

name: Vijay Alagarraj
text:
Service was good but food was not: Cesar salad didn’t have enough dressing or croutons.
We got Gardenia pizza: it was soggy (May be from too much toppings?).

name: Mike B
text: Pizza was great but waiter short changed me by $10.00

name: Michael Maree
text: In from out of town, some of the best pizza I've had. Crust is crisp on the outside and chewy inside. Real whole milk mozzarella! Pasta primavera was pretty good, slightly overcooked noodles but great veggies. Recommended.

name: Tecno-Advanced Concepts
text: Kindred, Arlene and Mellissa makes every visit to this place a memory to cherish... thx for feeding me... and treating me and my collegues so well... specially Kindred whom let us all enjoy her awesome blue and purple hair.   🥰😍😎😉

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: You have to stop by when you are in the area. The pizza and pasta was delicious! The service was top notch. Also, the portion sizes were incredibly generous. The place has a homey feel and is simply decorated with pieces from local artists. I'll be back! #favorite #letsguide #mytopten

name: Robin Luck
text: Stayed at a nearby hotel they delivered very quick.   Love love their Pizza and the Greek salad was so amazingly fresh and delicious.  I will order again,  great food!! Impressed

name: Michelle L.
text: Absolutely incredible. The whole place is charming and tucked next to the coolest bookstore. The pizza is incredible, and what I would describe as being the best pizza I've ever eaten. The Cadillac pizza tastes like the chef absolutely loves to cook. The staff is so friendly, the ambience delightful. I don't know when I've enjoyed a meal more.

name: Abdul Kader Surti
text: The pizza's are good, a bit on the pricey side. Wish the place looked better and has good seating options.

name: kraig Kitchens
text: Service and food were good, but the 75 health rating was concerning and they were understaffed for a Saturday night

name: Brian Shillingford
text: If I could rate this place higher than 5 stars I would.  "Pizzeria Delphina" is an adorable small local restaurant that serves fabulous pizza and possibly the best "Fettuccine Alfredo" I've ever had. If you're passing through downtown Mobile and feeling hungry. You have to stop here.

name: Chris Williams
text: Food was good, but not the best. Service was great. Prices were comparable to other restaurants around. They have beer and wine. Wish they had liquor.

name: John Leverette
text: Because I was a part of literally building the restaurant grand opening it and running it for over a year I have a hard time saying this because I'm no longer a part of it. They are excellent everything is top-notch you will not find better fare anywhere if you want truly good cooked food done properly and from scratch you will go there.

name: Aaron Headley
text: Excellent pizza! Tried the greco and a custom and both were excellent.

name: Mandy Touchstone
text: Always 5 star meal and service...DELICIOUS!

name: Bruce Whaleham
text: I’m allergic to gluten and I’m lactose intolerant and I ordered the normal fettuccine alfredo. I paid for the meal and the pain that came from my bodies inability to process those ingredients and I don’t regret my decision at all. 10/10 fantastic food and service, they were understaffed and they were very apologetic about it but still not a long wait.

name: ben barnett
text: The food tasted very fresh. It was great.

name: Minio Rodriquez
text: Absolutely loved it, was blown away from the flavor and value.  We sat inside, by a window.  Had the brushetta...large pie, a couple of sandwiches 😋 👌 and all was stellar.  Very large portions.  First time in mobile, we will be back.

name: JGirl Do
text: Friendly family style Italian food. Had the Puttanesca and it was delicious.  They chopped the olive mixture (Muffuletta style) in the sauce. The restaurant was busy. The prices were good and the service was great.

name: Damian Ferguson
text: Cool little spot close to the square. We were passing through on I-10 and was worth the stop. The pizza was great and the service was good - plus I love the name.  Good food for a good price.

name: Jessica Watkins
text: Great pizza..

name: Nicholas Bertagnolli
text: Best food around mobile and baldwin County by far.

name: Rocky Oubre
text: I love their pizza dough. 2 for 1 🍕 on Wednesday too🔥

name: Caisy CG
text: We ordered 2 Stromboli's and a pizza. Everything was delicious! The marinara sauce has such a fantastic, fresh basil and roasted garlic flavor(make sure to add some as a side if you get stromboli!) This was our first time trying it- I will definitely be getting dinner from here again! Next time, maybe,we will try pasta or a poboy, yummy 🙂

name: Ovad A Metab
text: Amazing pizza 🍕

name: Tammi Chase
text: Best little whole in the wall Pizzeria you will find. I recommend  the Cadillac pizza or one of their extremely large calzones!

name: Judah Sixsmith
text: My mom and I recently sat down for a late lunch and wine on the patio. If it's a beautiful day, sit outside! There's great Sundance Square people-watching. I usually prefer to sit inside at the bar, I love a good bar and Bird Cafe's is up there! But when the weather is great, it's definitely patio time

name: Po La
text: Ordered a large parma pizza (their largest is 14 inch which is medium at other places) and 2 small greek salads which cost me $43.50. Totally tasteless like they forgot spices exist. Dough was wet and soggy from watered down sauce which had zero salt and also no taste. Greek salad was ok, not a big fan of the chopped olive salad on top, surprisingly dressing was very good. Pizza was not good so I'm  giving only 1 star, Italian restaurant should know how to do it right as pizza is a staple.

name: Colt Mandy
text:
Great hole-in-the-wall Italian join downtown. Very casual, laid back place with a handful of patio tables. I ordered the Greek salad (which came with feta and shredded cheddar cheese?) which was decently sized for a small salad, with a giant scoop of olive salad on top. Good if you love olives!

For my main I had the pasta primavera which was a huge portion for a small (they also have a large option), and had plenty of fresh slices of zucchini. There was too much olive oil, but it had a nice flavor and will make a nice lunch tomorrow!

Pizzas and calzones look solid but the pastas and salads looked the best from what I observed.

Service was just ok but pretty efficient. The bar selections are limited to a few beers and wines, but definitely enough to wash down a hearty, carby meal. Will definitely be back for a quick bite.

name: caitlin walsh
text: If I could give this place zero stars I still don't think that would be enough. We heard good things about this place and were in town visiting so decided to try it. We sat down and ordered almost right away, and over an hour into waiting still had not received the side salads. After finally getting the salad, not even two minutes later we got ONE of the two entrees. The pasta dish was cold and lacked anything exciting. The breadstick it came with was stale and could break teeth. 35 minutes later the second entree arrived(a sandwich) that was supposed to be salami and but had bologna on it. Before the sandwich arrived we had asked for boxes and a check. We also ordered half of the items, and was charged for a whole. We had to take our food to go, after over 1.5 hours of waiting, and then did not eat it because of the quality. Save your money, squid inks just around the corner is way better. The staff was less than welcoming or apologetic.

name: Sean O'Neill
text: Very pleased with our pizza.  Not the best pizza I've ever had but definitely a repeat place to visit when back in Mobile.  The service was very nice and quick.

name: Clayton Stanley
text: Terrible customer service. Were basically told we couldn't eat there.

name: Jason Whiddon
text: Excellent Italian, just stay away if on diet!

name: A Hunter
text: Food is good, more than enough on your platter. Staff could be a bit more welcoming. Pricing, well it is on Dauphin St downtown so I guess that's why they charge so much? Overall good food, great location.

name: Katherine Blankenhorn
text: Had an amazing dinner the last night of the 1065 concert series. The food was great and so was our service.

name: Susan Nettles
text: I love the cozy atmosphere, but the food is the star of the show. The calzones are incredible and the pasta is authentic and fresh. I highly recommend.

name: QUAWON BATTISTE
text: Best 🍕 in Mobile! I even forget my credit card and they were able to make accommodation for me.  P.S. No, I didn't have to wash the dishes.

name: Jasper Brock
text: Great pizza even better staff

name: TJ McMeans
text: Great food as always!

name: Doris Windham
text: When you are in Mobile do eat here.

name: Jaime Asatsuyu Hammack
text: Get the marinated feta. The bread that comes with it is magical even on its own, and paired with the herby, oiled feta cubes? Incredibly delicious.

name: Jessie Quarterman
text: A Great personal and comforting environment! Very Professional staff helps your experience here worth every visit!

name: Thomas Moynihan
text:
LOVE this place. Such a quaint hole in the wall that serves some of the best pizza I have found in the Mobile area. I absolutely enjoy the Le Cadillac and the pasta dishes too.

I will say that because it's a small place, it's hard to get a table sometimes, so make sure you get there before 6 or so on busy days!

name: Dustin Judice
text: Pizza and pasta is excellent, great service for dine in or take out. My favorite pizza place is Mobile.

name: Theodore Veterinary
text: Great Handmade Pizzas!  Our staff loves when we order pizza for everyone.

name: Monica Raybon
text: The Le Cadillac pizza with added feta cheese was the bomb..... there is not a bad menu item  in this place

name: Dylan Daughety
text: Pizzeria Delphina is a cozy little restaurant with great food and quality service. I highly recommend  a visit if you are downtown Mobile looking for a bite to eat.

name: Jim Valente
text: The BEST Pizza and Pasta in downtown Mobile.

name: Gage McLain
text: OMG you are missing out if you don't go eat here. The atmosphere is great for dates and family dinners out. They give you so much food that you can't eat it all. The waitress we had was so nice. I highly recommend coming to eat here

name: Jennifer Gardner
text: Wonderfully delicious pizza!! Stromboli was delicious as well. Good prices. Large portions!

name: Diana Propper de Callejon
text: Excellent pizza, crispy crust! The salads are delicious. Nice casual place with seating outside. Highly recommended

name: Stephanie Young
text: Food is always good.  Today there was a long wait and we had to get out food to go.

name: Charlotte
text: I am vegan and the Capellini pasta is phenomenal.

name: Lorenzo Winters
text: While recently in Mobile, my wife and I decided to check out Pizzeria Delphina given the good reviews. My wife, being the adventurous one, suggested we try the La Greco. All I can say is Wow. The feta cheese was generously spread over the pizza but the olive salad (a mixture of several olive types) was the big surprise. We love a thin crust and this crust did not disappoint. The pizza was magnificent. We sat in the front window and enjoyed the people watching and pizza. The service was excellent. It was a special lunch.

name: Noble Taylor
text: I can't count the number of times I've had a cheese pizza before. This place makes cheese pizza that tastes better than most other stores Gourmet Pizza. Best mozzarella I have ever had at a restaurant

name: Eric Jones
text: The food is superb. Highly recommend if nearby.

name: Dillon Allen
text: Great handmade pizza in the heart of Mobile. I never end a night after Pizzeria Delphina with room left in my belly. Great menu, but also offers fully customizable pizzas. The meatballs are wicked good. Just give it a try!

name: Coty Alexander
text: Delicious pasta and pizza in a little building. Service is always amazing.

name: David Carpenter
text: Food is delicious.  Atmosphere is quaint.  Every time we have been there the service is good.  If you are in Downtown Mobile, this place is definitely worth a try.

name: Dillon Allen
text: Great handmade pizza in the heart of Mobile. I never end a night after Pizzeria Delphina with room left in my belly. Great menu, but also offers fully customizable pizzas. The meatballs are wicked good. Just give it a try!

name: Noble Taylor
text: I can't count the number of times I've had a cheese pizza before. This place makes cheese pizza that tastes better than most other stores Gourmet Pizza. Best mozzarella I have ever had at a restaurant

name: Stephanie Dwyer
text: The best Caesar salad I’ve had in a long time. Definitely an establishment where you get more bang for the buck and I loved the simplistic atmosphere. The waitstaff works as a team so you interact with several upbeat personalities. The meatballs were perfect and the Alfredo Sauce is worth going back for. I was even happy with the 𝑯𝒐𝒖𝒔𝒆 Pinot. Highly recommend!

name: Wendy McElroy
text: Had the BEST pizza and service! Such a neat little place!!

name: Coty Alexander
text: Delicious pasta and pizza in a little building. Service is always amazing.

name: Edward Newman
text: The wait staff were all very pleasant small cozy atmosphere but that was all that was small the portions are large. You by far get your money's worth and then some. I had the chicken fettuccine alfredo and it was delicious

name: David Clark
text: I have had their pizzas a few times and they are very good. They also serve a variety of typical Italian dishes which are mostly good. The service is usually good, but sometimes getting your food can be a little slow. The restaurant is fairly small and can get crowded at times, so plan accordingly. Pizzeria Delphina is located in a old storefront in downtown Mobile and the surroundings are pleasant.

name: Casey Roberts
text: Great food and wait staff. If I'm downtown I usually eat here for lunch. Never a disappointment. Try the marinated feta

name: Erica Davis
text: The food was good, but the place is tiny with hardly any seating. We sat outside and the table felt like it was about to fall apart. Really an awkward experience

name: David Carpenter
text: Food is delicious.  Atmosphere is quaint.  Every time we have been there the service is good.  If you are in Downtown Mobile, this place is definitely worth a try.

name: Ina Washington
text: The pizza was GREAT! We come here every year when we go to our conference.  The staff was super nice!

name: Valarie Smith
text: Good friendly businesses. The PIZZA was great!   After a visit  to the Monsters Truck. I was happy to see they stayed open to serve us'Thank all and Tia :~)

name: Laura W
text: I went here twice. Once with my sister and once with my boyfriend. Both times it was absolutely amazing. I ordered a margherita pizza and it was delicious. My boyfriend actually grew up in Italy and he said the pizza was amazing too.

name: Lloyd Logue
text: Great service and pizza...Pesto Scampi!

name: Stephanie Dwyer
text: The best Caesar salad I’ve had in a long time. Definitely an establishment where you get more bang for the buck and I loved the simplistic atmosphere. The waitstaff works as a team so you interact with several upbeat personalities. The meatballs were perfect and the Alfredo Sauce is worth going back for. I was even happy with the 𝑯𝒐𝒖𝒔𝒆 Pinot. Highly recommend!

name: David Clark
text: I have had their pizzas a few times and they are very good. They also serve a variety of typical Italian dishes which are mostly good. The service is usually good, but sometimes getting your food can be a little slow. The restaurant is fairly small and can get crowded at times, so plan accordingly. Pizzeria Delphina is located in a old storefront in downtown Mobile and the surroundings are pleasant.

name: Chris Davinroy
text: We are on vacation from St Louis and only in Mobile for one night. I had a huge lunch in Memphis so I wasnt very hungry but my wife was. We decided on pizza and splitting a salad. Knowing the portions back home, we ordered a large salad - that was a HUGE mistake. The operative word is huge because that's the size of the portions! We also ordered a small pizza (which was the perfect size for us to split) and the only thing "wrong" with it was that I could have used extra cheese on top to help hold on the toppings. Thanks for taking care of us PD!

name: Erica Davis
text: The food was good, but the place is tiny with hardly any seating. We sat outside and the table felt like it was about to fall apart. Really an awkward experience

name: Brett Williams
text: Best pasta in the city hands down. They were packed and our service was still prompt and courteous. Dope atmosphere too.

name: Shoals Yakkin' with Hatch
text: Awesome little pizza place with an awesome Stromboli and good red wine.

name: Christopher Goens
text: Cozy atmosphere, great food at a reasonable price for such large portions, and friendly service. Will definitely be going many more times!

name: John Martin
text: Best chicken ceasar salad in a long time, her pasta primavera with added shrimp was good as well.

name: Peter Trivanovich
text: Good pizza.

name: Connie Caraway
text: Fun little store. Nice restrooms :-)

name: Chase Nelson
text: Flies everywhere, rude staff when we walked in to place an order, and when paying they do not even inform the customer they charge you to pay with a credit card. They simply don’t want to pay the merchant processor the small fee when collecting profit. So they just double up. Last time I checked, we you take money from someone without notice or permission it’s called theft!

name: Jason Fountain
text: The servers and food is fabulous

name: Shane “LIL KILLA” Singleton Sr.
text: Thjs is where i work at....

name: Yaminou Oyeossi
text: Drove off the highway to get some real food. Came to the closest pizzeria I could find and then walked around downtown Mobile. A lot of history in these buildings.

name: Aimee Sherrod
text:
**update**
Server was super nice and the food is amazing. Food is 5 star for sure, but couldn’t get over the first impression. My advice? Order takeout from them.

First impression is a one star. I’ll update if anything changes.

Just walked in. There were two other couples in line in front of us. One couple walked out after being ignored and ran over by staff. The next couple consisted of a very pregnant young woman and her date. They also were ignored and ran over. They finally left.

I stopped a staff member to inquire if we were to just seat ourselves or??? I was told there’s a waitlist and then she rushed off. No idea where this list was. Open table. Open seats at the bar. We waited a bit longer and finally got seated.

I’ll update when the food comes out.

name: Tosha Thibeau
text: We went in here while on our way to Gulf Shores on vacation and they treated my family and I so great. The waitress we had was amazing - especially with our autistic son. She really made him feel special!

name: Chase Nelson
text: Flies everywhere, rude staff when we walked in to place an order, and when paying they do not even inform the customer they charge you to pay with a credit card. They simply don’t want to pay the merchant processor the small fee when collecting profit. So they just double up. Last time I checked, we you take money from someone without notice or permission it’s called theft!

name: Chris Jones
text: Best greek salad my wife has ever had. Friendly and speedy staff. Cozy atmosphere indoors. Outside seating available.

name: David Hawkins
text: I'm from NY and am always on the hunt for good pizzeria/Italian places and this was a great find! Not very many places along the gulf coast do pizza and Italian very well, but Delphina is one of the best. Very reasonable prices and very generous portion sizes.

name: E Davis
text: Was ok decent prices ok good cozy atmosphere and friendly staff.

name: Jason Fountain
text: The servers and food is fabulous

name: Yaminou Oyeossi
text: Drove off the highway to get some real food. Came to the closest pizzeria I could find and then walked around downtown Mobile. A lot of history in these buildings.

name: Nicolas Bertrand
text: Stayed in Mobile and saw that this pizza place had a lot of good reviews. Sadly, I was disappointed. Ordered a large pepperoni for $17 and it was the size of most mediums. The cheese was the best part. Other than that it lacked flavor, sauce and the crust was burnt and hard in a few spots. I expected a lot more and was let down.

name: Jordan Greiner
text: It's a small quiet pizzaria, amazing location, interesting menu options, and the most amazing Feta appetiser that I've ever had!

name: phillip zangas
text: Awesome food and even better service!

text: Meatball app was awesome. Pizza was made with fresh veggies. Overall really good experience.

name: James Daigle
text: Meatball app was awesome. Pizza was made with fresh veggies. Overall really good experience.

name: Paul Griffin
text: I ordered a Chicken Parm PoBoy. Couldn't eat it all. Largest PoBoy I've ever seen. Ever.  Cheap too. Highly recommended.

text: Pizza was tasty with homemade sausage. Maybe a hair on the pricey side but I'll be back for sure. Great service and place was clean.

name: Oscar Manuel Castillo Jimenez
text: Best pizza ever!!!

name: Esteban Serrano
text: Top 3 pizza I've ever eaten! Great food, great attention and it is located in a good place of town. I easily recommend it to anyone who likes a great thin-crusted pizza or would like a great almond cheesecake. Just yum.

name: Alexis Cole
text: Simply delicious & great service!

name: Christina Smith
text: Amazing Mexican pizza and chicken alfredo!!!! Definitely recommend!!

name: Laura Lee
text: Great local pizza place. It was a little tough to find, but well worth the hunt. We had bruschetta and a couple of pizzas. So delish!

name: Patrick Robison
text:
Staying in downtown Mobile and hotel suggested this establishment.  Never got the opportunity to try the so called "amazing" food!  I'm sure it is good as it came highly recommended.  I would not spend one dime of my $$ in here as the owner is a complete jerk.  Servers were more than happy to help us with a party of 7, but the owner made us move the tables that the servers said to put together.  Now I didn't mind that and completely understood the issue but his attitude was terrible.  Told me there were plenty of other places to eat around there. Lol.

Okay....we did and had an amazing dinner right down the street.  Maybe he was just having a bad day but don't think so...everyone seemed scared of him.  What an idiot!  Still sorry I didn't get to taste the food cause we did hear it was great.  Probably cause he's not cooking it.  Feedback given to hotel as well.

name: James A. Mazzaro
text: Tried the caprese salad, a meatball, and the pesto scampi pizza. The caprese was good, the tomato was the only weak spot. The meatball was very tasty, well complemented my the house marinara. The pizza was also top notch. Too bad I don’t live anywhere near here or I would definitely be a regular. Service by Melissa was exemplary.

name: Jake Apperson
text: Went on the advice of local hotel employee while we were in Mobile for the weekend. Could not have been happier with the place. The cafe area was a bit small but we were there before a rush started so we had a great table and view. Food was AMAZING!

name: Garrett C
text:
BEWARE: Current Google maps information is misleading. The website and a few of the images displayed are from another restaurant in California.

We went expecting something different, given the images presented on Google, so when we first arrived we were a bit confused, but decided to go with it anyway. No appetizers are offered, which is disappointing. Our service was friendly and our pizza was served quickly (within 15 minutes or so). We were both pretty impressed and would most likely return.

name: Oscar Manuel Castillo Jimenez
text: Best pizza ever!!!

name: Alexis Cole
text: Simply delicious & great service!

name: Max D

name: Christina Smith
